newsitem.title: USA: FINEX to start trading dollar/rand futures Thurs..
newsitem.headline: FINEX to start trading dollar/rand futures Thurs..

text.p: FINEX, the financial division of the New York Cotton Exchange (NYCE), is to start trading a new U.S. dollar/South African rand futures contract on Thursday April 3, NYCE vice president Charles Minaar said.
The new contract will be the first of eleven new currency futures contracts to be offered by FINEX in the near future.
The other 10 products to be launched include seven U.S. dollar currency paired futures contracts which are actively traded in the interbank market, and three cross-rate currency contracts.
Currency trading on FINEX is provided via open outcry trading in both European and U.S. timezones on its Dublin and New York trading facilities.
The existing FINEX currency complex set a new monthly trading volume record in March with over 87,000 contracts traded, Minaar said.

FINEX will shortly launch the following contracts: U.S. dollar/Australian dollar, U.S. dollar/New Zealand, U.S. dollar/Canadian dollar, Deutschemark/Spanish peseta, British pound/Swiss franc, and British pound/Japanese yen.

Further contracts on U.S. dollar/Malaysian ringgit, U.S. dollar/Singapore dollar, U.S. dollar/Indonesian rupiah, and U.S. dollar/Thai baht are still awaiting approval by the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC).
